intro: Triglochin debilis, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments in temperate regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender, triangular stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Triglochin debilis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates in its wetland habitat.
